sen.j: 外郎売（ういろう うり）は歌舞伎十八番の一つ。
sen.e: Uiro uri is one of Kabuki juhachiban (eighteen best plays of the Ichikawa family of kabuki actors).
Uiro uri is one of Kabuki juhachiban (eighteen best plays of the Ichikawa family of kabuki actors).
Uiro uri is one of Kabuki juhachiban (eighteen best plays of the Ichikawa family of kabuki actors).

sen.j: いわゆる「曾我物」のひとつ『若緑勢曾我』（わかみどり いきおい そが）の一幕を一部を独立させたものである。
sen.e: Originally it was a part of an act in "Wakamidori Ikioi Soga" (Verdant Green and the Energetic Soga), one of so-called Sogamono (programs based on The Tale of the Soga), and later became an independent program.

Originally it was a part of an act in "Wakamidori Ikioi Soga" (Verdant Green and the Energetic Soga), one of so-called Sogamono (programs based on The Tale of the Soga), that later became an independent program.

Originally it was a part of an act in "Wakamidori Ikioi Soga" (Verdant Green and the Energetic Soga), one of so-called Sogamono (programs based on The Tale of the Soga), that later became an independent program.

sen.j: 享保3年 (1718) 正月、江戸 森田座で初演。
sen.e: It was premiered at the Morita-za Theater in Edo in January 1718.
It was premiered at the Morita-za Theater in Edo in January 1718.
It was premiered at the Morita-za Theater in Edo in January 1718.

sen.j: 「外郎売実ハ曾我五郎」は市川團十郎 (2代目)が勤めた。
sen.e: The role of 'The Medicine Peddler whose true identity is SOGA no Goro' was acted by Danjuro ICHIKAWA (the 2nd).
The role of 'The Medicine Peddler whose true identity is SOGA no Goro' was acted by Danjuro ICHIKAWA (the 2nd).
The role of 'The Medicine Peddler whose true identity is SOGA no Goro' was acted by Danjuro ICHIKAWA (the 2nd).

sen.j: 今日では「外郎売」と言えばその劇中に出てくる外郎売の長科白を指すことが多い。
sen.e: Today, in many cases, the term 'Uiro uri' refers to the medicine peddler's long speech in the play.
sen.cmt: 用語検索で「長科白」は "nagazerifu (tirade)" となっていますが、ここでは "a long speech" とする方が適当と思い、そのように訳出しました。
sen.e: Today, in many cases, the term 'Uiro uri' refers to the medicine peddler's long speech in the play.
Today, in many cases, the term 'Uiro uri' refers to the medicine peddler's long speech in the play.

sen.j: 俳優やタレントなどの養成所で発声練習や滑舌の練習に使われている。
sen.e: It is practiced for vocal exercises and exercises in articulation at training schools for actors and entertainers.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is used for vocal and articulation exercises at training schools for actors and entertainers.
It is used for vocal and articulation exercises at training schools for actors and entertainers.

sen.j: ただし漢字の読みやアクセントが養成所ごとに千差万別である。
sen.e: The reading of Chinese characters and the pitch accent of the speech varies with the school.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The readings of Kanji characters and pitch accents of the speech vary with the school.
The readings of Kanji characters and pitch accents of the speech vary with the school.

sen.j: 外郎売の口上
sen.e: The Medicine Peddler's pitch
sen.cmt: 用語検索で「口上」は "kojo (a ceremony to announce that an actor takes a new stage name) " となっていますが、この原文においては売り込み口上のことですので "pitch" としました。
sen.e: The Medicine Peddler's pitch
The Medicine Peddler's pitch

sen.j: 拙者親方と申すは、御立会の内に御存知の御方も御座りましょうが、御江戸を発って二十里上方、相州小田原市一色町を御過ぎなされて、青物町を上りへ御出でなさるれば、欄干橋虎屋藤右衛門、只今では剃髪致して圓斎と名乗りまする。
sen.e: My master is, I guess some of you already know, 78.54 km away from Edo in the direction of Kyoto, passing through Isshiki town, Odawara City, Sagami Province, then going further from Aomono town toward Kyoto, there he lives, Rankanbashi Toraya Toemon, now he is tonsured and calls himself Ensai.

My master is, I guess some of you already know, 78.54 km away from Edo in the direction of Kyoto, passing through Isshiki town, Odawara City, Sagami Province, then going further from Aomono town toward Kyoto, there he lives, Rankanbashi Toraya Toemon, now he is tonsured and calls himself Ensai.

My master is, I guess some of you already know, 78.54 km away from Edo in the direction of Kyoto, passing through Isshiki town, Odawara City, Sagami Province, then going further from Aomono town toward Kyoto, there he lives, Rankanbashi Toraya Toemon, now he is tonsured and calls himself Ensai.

sen.j: 元日より大晦日まで御手に入れまする此の薬は、昔、珍の国の唐人外郎 (薬品)と云う人、我が朝へ来たり。
sen.e: This medicine, which is available from New Year's Day to New Year's Eve, dates back to the day when a foreigner from the country of Chin (珍), named Uiro, came to our country long ago.
sen.cmt: 珍の国－定訳不明。ただし、ほるぷ出版『外郎売』には「陳の国」(Chen)とあり、こちらだと意味が通ります。原文には (薬品) とありますが、リンク先の単語が抽出されるバグのようですので、訳出しておりません。
sen.e: This medicine, which is available from New Year's Day to New Year's Eve, dates back to the day when a foreigner from the country of Chin (珍), named Uiro, came to our country long ago.
This medicine, which is available from New Year's Day to New Year's Eve, dates back to the day when a foreigner from the country of Chin (珍), named Uiro, came to our country long ago.

sen.j: 帝へ参内の折から此の薬を深く込め置き、用ゆる時は一粒ずつ冠の隙間より取り出だす。
sen.e: After he visited to the Imperial Palace he hid this medicine away, and when he used it, he took pills from under the court cap one by one.
After he visited to the Imperial Palace he hid this medicine far away, and each time when he needed, he took one pill from the space of the court cap.
sen.cmt: 原文に合わせて訳を変えました。
sen.e: After he visited to the Imperial Palace he hid this medicine far away, and each time when he needed, he took one pill from the space of the court cap.

sen.j: 依ってその名を帝より「透頂香」と賜る。
sen.e: From this, the medicine was named 'Tochinko' by the Emperor.
From this, the medicine was named 'Tochinko' by the Emperor.
From this, the medicine was named 'Tochinko' by the Emperor.

sen.j: 即ち文字には頂き・透く・香と書いて透頂香と申す。
sen.e: That is, with letters for head (頂) clearing (透) scent (香), it's pronounced Tochinko.
That is, with letters for head (頂) clearing (透) scent (香), it's pronounced Tochinko.
That is, with letters for head (頂) clearing (透) scent (香), it's pronounced Tochinko.

sen.j: 只今では此の薬、殊の外、世上に広まり、方々に偽看板を出だし、イヤ小田原の、灰俵の、さん俵の、炭俵のと色々に申せども、平仮名を以って「ういろう」と記せしは親方圓斎ばかり。
sen.e: These days, unexpectedly, this medicine has become widespread in the world; there are dishonest signs everywhere, saying it's made in Odawara, haidawara (straw bag of ash), sandawara (lid of komedawara, rice bag), sumidawara (straw bag for charcoal), etc., but it's only my master Ensai who gives 'uiro' in hiragana (Japanese syllabary characters).

These days, unexpectedly, this medicine has become widespread in the world; there are dishonest signs everywhere, saying it's made in Odawara, haidawara (straw bag of ash), sandawara (lid of komedawara, rice bag), sumidawara (straw bag for charcoal), etc., but it's only my master Ensai who gives 'uiro' in hiragana (Japanese syllabary characters).

These days, unexpectedly, this medicine has become widespread in the world; there are dishonest signs everywhere, saying it's made in Odawara, haidawara (straw bag of ash), sandawara (lid of komedawara, rice bag), sumidawara (straw bag for charcoal), etc., but it's only my master Ensai who gives 'uiro' in hiragana (Japanese syllabary characters).

sen.j: もしや御立会の内に、熱海市か箱根温泉塔ノ沢温泉へ湯治に御出でなさるるか、又は伊勢神宮御参宮の折からは、必ず門違いなされまするな。
sen.e: If you have the opportunity to go to Atami City, Hakone hotspring, or Tonosawa hotspring for the baths, or visit to Ise Jingu Shrine, be sure not to go to the wrong place.
If you have the opportunity to go to Atami City, Hakone hotspring, or Tonosawa hotspring for the baths, or visit to Ise Jingu Shrine, be sure not to go to the wrong place.
If you have the opportunity to go to Atami City, Hakone hotspring, or Tonosawa hotspring for the baths, or visit to Ise Jingu Shrine, be sure not to go to the wrong place.

sen.j: 御上りなれば右の方、御下りなれば左側、八方が八つ棟、面が三つ棟、玉堂造、破風には菊花紋章を御赦免あって、系図正しき薬で御座る。
sen.e: On the way to Kyoto it's on the right, on the way from Kyoto it's on the left, the store has eight ridges in eight direction and three beautiful ridges at the front; for the gables the crest of chrysanthemum and paulownia is permitted to use to prove this is the medicine of good lineage.
sen.cmt: 玉堂造－定訳不明。ほるぷ出版『外郎売』では「面が三つ棟、玉堂造」の部分について「正面に三棟の美しい棟がある」と説明されていますので、そのように訳出しました。原文には「菊花紋章」 とありますが、リンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語が「菊に桐の薹の御紋」となっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出しました。
sen.e: On the way to Kyoto it's on the right, on the way from Kyoto it's on the left, the store has eight ridges in eight direction and three beautiful ridges at the front; for the gables the crest of chrysanthemum and paulownia is permitted to use to prove this is the medicine of good lineage.

On the way to Kyoto it's on the right, on the way from Kyoto it's on the left, the store has eight ridges in eight direction and three beautiful ridges at the front; for the gables the crest of chrysanthemum and paulownia is permitted to use to prove this is the medicine of good lineage.

sen.j: イヤ最前より家名の自慢ばかり申しても、御存知無い方には正真の胡椒の丸呑み、白河夜船、されば一粒食べ掛けて、その気味合いを御目に掛けましょう。
sen.e: No matter how much I boast about the family name, for those who have no idea, it's like swallowing up real peppercorns or being asleep on a ship at night (they don't know what is going on), so I will try one pill to show you how it works.

No matter how much I boast about the family name, for those who have no idea, it's like swallowing up real peppercorns or being asleep on a ship at night (they don't know what is going on), so I will try one pill to show you how it works.

No matter how much I boast about the family name, for those who have no idea, it's like swallowing up real peppercorns or being asleep on a ship at night (they don't know what is going on), so I will try one pill to show you how it works.

sen.j: 先ず此の薬を斯様に一粒舌の上に乗せまして、腹内へ納めますると、イヤどうも言えぬわ、胃・心・肺・肝臓が健やかに成りて、薫風喉より来たり、口中微涼を生ずるが如し。
sen.e: First, put one pill on the tongue like this, and down it to the stomach, then, oh, I don't know what to say, the stomach, heart, lungs and liver has become healthy, and fragrant breath comes out from the throat to cause the slight coolness in the mouth.

First, put one pill on the tongue like this, and down it to the stomach, then, oh, I don't know what to say, the stomach, heart, lungs and liver has become healthy, and fragrant breath comes out from the throat to cause the slight coolness in the mouth.

First, put one pill on the tongue like this, and down it to the stomach, then, oh, I don't know what to say, the stomach, heart, lungs and liver has become healthy, and fragrant breath comes out from the throat to cause the slight coolness in the mouth.

sen.j: 魚・鳥・茸・麺類の食い合わせ、その他万病即効在る事神の如し。
sen.e: Not only health troubles caused by eating fish, fowl, mushrooms and noodles in unsuitable combination, but also all other diseases immediately disappear as if it's a work of God.
Not only health troubles caused by eating fish, fowl, mushrooms and noodles in unsuitable combination, but also all other diseases immediately disappear as if it's a work of God.
Not only health troubles caused by eating fish, fowl, mushrooms and noodles in unsuitable combination, but also all other diseases immediately disappear as if it's a work of God.

sen.j: さて此の薬、第一の奇妙には、舌の廻る事が銭ごまが裸足で逃げる。
sen.e: Well, the first amazing effect caused by this medicine is it makes you voluble and the motion of your tongue will be much faster and smoother than of spinning top.
Well, the first amazing effect caused by this medicine is it makes you voluble and the motion of your tongue will be much faster and smoother than of spinning top.
Well, the first amazing effect caused by this medicine is it makes you voluble and the motion of your tongue will be much faster and smoother than of spinning top.

sen.j: ヒョッと舌が廻り出すと矢も盾も堪らぬじゃ。
sen.e: Once your tongue starts moving, nothing can stop it.
Once your tongue starts moving, nothing can stop it.
Once your tongue starts moving, nothing can stop it.

sen.j: そりゃそりゃそらそりゃ、廻って来たわ、廻って来るわ。
sen.e: Sorya sorya sora sorya, mawatte kitawa, mawatte kuruwa (see, now I can speak smoothly).
sen.cmt: これ以降早口言葉となるため、日本語をそのままローマ字表記にし、意味を補足してあります（読み方の主な資料： ほるぷ出版『外郎売』。意味の主な資料： ほるぷ出版『外郎売』、http://hirose-gawa.web.infoseek.co.jp/uirou/01.html、http://www5a.biglobe.ne.jp/~taro-umi/training/uiro_lecture.htm）
sen.e: Sorya sorya sora sorya, mawatte kitawa, mawatte kuruwa (see, now I can speak smoothly).
Sorya sorya sora sorya, mawatte kitawa, mawatte kuruwa (see, now I can speak smoothly).

sen.j: アワヤ喉、サタラナ舌にカ牙音サ歯音、ハマの二つは五音。
sen.e: Awaya nondo, satarana zetsu ni ka ge sa shion, hama no futatsu wa kuchibiru no keicho (a, wa, ya are guttural; sa, ta, ra, na are lingual; ka is nasal and sa is dental; ha, ma are labial sound).
sen.cmt: 原文には「牙音」、 「五音」とありますが、リンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語が「牙」、「唇の軽重」となっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出しました。
sen.e: Awaya nondo, satarana zetsu ni ka ge sa shion, hama no futatsu wa kuchibiru no keicho (a, wa, ya are guttural; sa, ta, ra, na are lingual; ka is nasal and sa is dental; ha, ma are labial sound).
Awaya nondo, satarana zetsu ni ka ge sa shion, hama no futatsu wa kuchibiru no keicho (a, wa, ya are guttural; sa, ta, ra, na are lingual; ka is nasal and sa is dental; ha, ma are labial sound).

sen.j: 開合爽やかに、アカサタナハマヤラワ、オコソトノホモヨロヲ。
sen.e: Kaigo sawayaka ni (articulating clearly), akasatanahamayarawa, okosotonohomoyorowo.
Kaigo sawayaka ni (articulating clearly), akasatanahamayarawa, okosotonohomoyorowo.
Kaigo sawayaka ni (articulating clearly), akasatanahamayarawa, okosotonohomoyorowo.

sen.j: 一つへぎへぎ、かき餅・生姜、お盆豆・盆米・盆ゴボウ、摘タデ・摘豆・摘山椒。
sen.e: Hitotsu hegi hegi, hegihoshi hajikami, bonmame bongome bongobo, tsumitade tsumimame tsumizansho (together with cracker and ginger, beans, rice, burdock roots for Bon festival; and picked knotweeds, beans and pepper grains are put on a tray).
sen.cmt: 原文には「かき餅」 「生姜」「お盆豆」とありますが、リンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語が「へぎ干し」「はじかみ」「盆豆」となっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出しました。
sen.e: Hitotsu hegi hegi, hegihoshi hajikami, bonmame bongome bongobo, tsumitade tsumimame tsumizansho (together with cracker and ginger, beans, rice, burdock roots for Bon festival; and picked knotweeds, beans and pepper grains are put on a tray).

Hitotsu hegi hegi, hegihoshi hajikami, bonmame bongome bongobo, tsumitade tsumimame tsumizansho (together with cracker and ginger, beans, rice, burdock roots for Bon festival; and picked knotweeds, beans and pepper grains are put on a tray).

sen.j: 圓教寺の社僧正、小米の生噛み、小米の生噛み、こん小米のこ生噛み。
sen.e: Shoshazan no shasojo (a priest of Shoshazan Engyo-ji Temple), kogome no namagami (crunching uncooked rice fragments), kogome no namagami, kon-kogome no ko-namagami.
sen.cmt: 原文には「圓教寺」とありますが、リンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語が「書写山」となっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出しました。社僧上－定訳不明。早口言葉のための造語と推察します。
sen.e: Shoshazan no shasojo (a priest of Shoshazan Engyo-ji Temple), kogome no namagami (crunching uncooked rice fragments), kogome no namagami, kon-kogome no ko-namagami.
Shoshazan no shasojo (a priest of Shoshazan Engyo-ji Temple), kogome no namagami (crunching uncooked rice fragments), kogome no namagami, kon-kogome no ko-namagami.

sen.j: 本しゅす・緋繻子、繻子・繻珍。
sen.e: Shusu (satin) hijusu (scarlet satin), shusu shuchin (satin with raised figures).
sen.cmt: 原文には「本しゅす」とありますが、リンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語が「繻子」となっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出しました。
sen.e: Shusu (satin) hijusu (scarlet satin), shusu shuchin (satin with raised figures).
Shusu (satin) hijusu (scarlet satin), shusu shuchin (satin with raised figures).

sen.j: 親も嘉兵衛、子も嘉兵衛、親嘉兵衛・子嘉兵衛、子嘉兵衛・親嘉兵衛。
sen.e: Oya mo Kahe (father's name is Kahe), ko mo Kahe (the son is also Kahe), oya Kahe ko Kahe, ko Kahe oya Kahe.
Oya mo Kahe (father's name is Kahe), ko mo Kahe (the son is also Kahe), oya Kahe ko Kahe, ko Kahe oya Kahe.
Oya mo Kahe (father's name is Kahe), ko mo Kahe (the son is also Kahe), oya Kahe ko Kahe, ko Kahe oya Kahe.

sen.j: 古栗の木の古切り口。
sen.e: Furukuri no ki no furukirikuchi (the old cut end of an old chestnut tree).
Furukuri no ki no furukirikuchi (the old cut end of an old chestnut tree).
Furukuri no ki no furukirikuchi (the old cut end of an old chestnut tree).

sen.j: 雨合羽か番合羽か。
sen.e: Amagappa ka bangappa ka (a raincoat or coarse raincoat).
sen.cmt: 番合羽－ "bangappa" 定訳不明。造語と思われますが、「番」は粗末なものに冠する語ですので（例：番傘）、そのように訳出しました。
sen.e: Amagappa ka bangappa ka (a raincoat or coarse raincoat).
Amagappa ka bangappa ka (a raincoat or coarse raincoat).

sen.j: 貴様が脚絆も革脚絆、我等が脚絆も革脚絆。
sen.e: Kisama ga kyahan mo kawakyahan, warera ga kyahan mo kawakyahan (your gaiters are leather gaiters, our gaiters are leather gaiters, too).
Kisama ga kyahan mo kawakyahan, warera ga kyahan mo kawakyahan (your gaiters are leather gaiters, our gaiters are leather gaiters, too).
Kisama ga kyahan mo kawakyahan, warera ga kyahan mo kawakyahan (your gaiters are leather gaiters, our gaiters are leather gaiters, too).

sen.j: 尻革袴のしっ綻びを、三針針長にちょと縫うて、縫うてちょとぶん出せ。
sen.e: Shikkawabakama no shippokorobi wo, mihari harinaga ni choto nute, nute choto bundase (just sew up an open seam of the trousers with leather seat with three stitches more, and then throw it out).
Shikkawabakama no shippokorobi wo, mihari harinaga ni choto nute, nute choto bundase (just sew up an open seam of the trousers with leather seat with three stitches more, and then throw it out).
Shikkawabakama no shippokorobi wo, mihari harinaga ni choto nute, nute choto bundase (just sew up an open seam of the trousers with leather seat with three stitches more, and then throw it out).

sen.j: ナデシコ。
sen.e: Kawaranadeshiko nozekichiku (a pink, a wild China pink).
sen.cmt: 原文には「ナデシコ」とありますが、リンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語が「河原撫子・野石竹」となっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出しました。
sen.e: Kawaranadeshiko nozekichiku (a pink, a wild China pink).
Kawaranadeshiko nozekichiku (a pink, a wild China pink).

sen.j: 野良如来、野良如来、三野良如来に六野良如来。
sen.e: Nora nyorai (Tathagata in the fields) nora nyorai mi (three) nora nyorai ni (and) mu (six) nora nyorai.
sen.cmt: 野良如来－ "Nora Nyorai" 定訳不明。早口言葉のための造語と推察しますが、野良の如来（Tathagata in the fields）として訳出しました。
sen.e: Nora nyorai (Tathagata in the fields) nora nyorai mi (three) nora nyorai ni (and) mu (six) nora nyorai.
Nora nyorai (Tathagata in the fields) nora nyorai mi (three) nora nyorai ni (and) mu (six) nora nyorai.

sen.j: 一寸先の御小仏に御蹴躓きゃるな、細溝にドジョウにょろり。
sen.e: Issun saki no okobotoke ni oketsumazukyaru na (don't stumble on the small statue of Buddha right over there), hosomizo ni dojo nyorori (a loach is slithering through the narrow ditch).
Issun saki no okobotoke ni oketsumazukyaru na (don't stumble on the small statue of Buddha right over there), hosomizo ni dojo nyorori (a loach is slithering through the narrow ditch).
Issun saki no okobotoke ni oketsumazukyaru na (don't stumble on the small statue of Buddha right over there), hosomizo ni dojo nyorori (a loach is slithering through the narrow ditch).

sen.j: 京の生鱈、奈良生真名カツオ、ちょと四五貫目。
sen.e: Kyo no namadara (a raw cod from the capital), Nara nama managatsuo (a raw pomfret in Nara), choto shigo kanme (just 15 or 18.75 kg).
Kyo no namadara (a raw cod from the capital), Nara nama managatsuo (a raw pomfret in Nara), choto shigo kanme (just 15 or 18.75 kg).
Kyo no namadara (a raw cod from the capital), Nara nama managatsuo (a raw pomfret in Nara), choto shigo kanme (just 15 or 18.75 kg).

sen.j: 御茶立ちょ、茶立ちょ、ちゃっと立ちょ。
sen.e: Ocha tacho (make tea), cha tacho, chatto tacho (make quickly).
Ocha tacho (make tea), cha tacho, chatto tacho (make quickly).
Ocha tacho (make tea), cha tacho, chatto tacho (make quickly).

sen.j: 茶立ちょ、青竹茶筅で御茶ちゃっと立ちゃ。
sen.e: Cha tacho, aotake chasen de (with a green-bamboo tea whisk) ocha chatto tacha (tea is made quickly).
Cha tacho, aotake chasen de (with a green-bamboo tea whisk) ocha chatto tacha (tea is made quickly).
Cha tacho, aotake chasen de (with a green-bamboo tea whisk) ocha chatto tacha (tea is made quickly).

sen.j: 来るは来るは何が来る、高野山の御柿小僧、狸百匹、箸百膳、天目茶碗百杯、棒八百本。
sen.e: Kuru wa kuru wa nani ga kuru (it's coming, it's coming, what's coming), Koya no yama no (of Mt. Koya) okokera (shavings) kozo (a trainee priest), tanuki hyappiki, hashi hyaku zen, tenmoku hyappai, bo happyappon (100 raccoon dogs, 100 pair of chopsticks, 100 teabowls and 100 sticks).
sen.cmt: 原文には「天目茶碗」とありますが、リンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語が「天目」となっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われますので、音の表記にはこちらを使用しました（意味は同じ）。
sen.e: Kuru wa kuru wa nani ga kuru (it's coming, it's coming, what's coming), Koya no yama no (of Mt. Koya) okokera (shavings) kozo (a trainee priest), tanuki hyappiki, hashi hyaku zen, tenmoku hyappai, bo happyappon (100 raccoon dogs, 100 pair of chopsticks, 100 teabowls and 100 sticks).

Kuru wa kuru wa nani ga kuru (it's coming, it's coming, what's coming), Koya no yama no (of Mt. Koya) okokera (shavings) kozo (a trainee priest), tanuki hyappiki, hashi hyaku zen, tenmoku hyappai, bo happyappon (100 raccoon dogs, 100 pair of chopsticks, 100 teabowls and 100 sticks).

sen.j: 武具、馬具、武具馬具、三武具馬具、合わせて武具馬具、六武具馬具。
sen.e: Bugu (arms), bagu (harness), bugu bagu, mi (three) bugu bagu, awasete (altogether) bugu bagu mu (six) bugu bagu.
Bugu (arms), bagu (harness), bugu bagu, mi (three) bugu bagu, awasete (altogether) bugu bagu mu (six) bugu bagu.
Bugu (arms), bagu (harness), bugu bagu, mi (three) bugu bagu, awasete (altogether) bugu bagu mu (six) bugu bagu.

sen.j: 菊、栗、菊栗、三菊栗、合わせて菊栗、六菊栗。
sen.e: Kiku (chrysanthemum), kiri (paulownia), kiku kiri, mi kiku kiri, awasete kiku kiri, mu kiku kiri.
Kiku (chrysanthemum), kiri (paulownia), kiku kiri, mi kiku kiri, awasete kiku kiri, mu kiku kiri.
Kiku (chrysanthemum), kiri (paulownia), kiku kiri, mi kiku kiri, awasete kiku kiri, mu kiku kiri.

sen.j: 麦、塵、麦塵、三麦塵、合わせて麦塵、六麦塵。
sen.e: Mugi (wheat), gomi (dust), mugi gomi, mi mugi gomi, awasete mugi gomi, mu mugi gomi.
Mugi (wheat), gomi (dust), mugi gomi, mi mugi gomi, awasete mugi gomi, mu mugi gomi.
Mugi (wheat), gomi (dust), mugi gomi, mi mugi gomi, awasete mugi gomi, mu mugi gomi.

sen.j: あの長押の薙刀は誰が長薙刀ぞ。
sen.e: Ano nageshi no naganaginata wa ta ga naganaginata zo (whose long halberd is that halberd on the horizontal piece of timber in the frame of the house)?
Ano nageshi no naganaginata wa ta ga naganaginata zo (whose long halberd is that halberd on the horizontal piece of timber in the frame of the house)?
Ano nageshi no naganaginata wa ta ga naganaginata zo (whose long halberd is that halberd on the horizontal piece of timber in the frame of the house)?

sen.j: 向こうの胡麻殻はエゴマの胡麻殻か真胡麻殻か、あれこそ本の真胡麻殻。
sen.e: Muko no gomagara wa e no gomagara ka magomagara ka, are koso hon no magomagara (I wonder the sesame husks over there are of perilla or ordinary sesame, they are real ordinary sesame husks).
sen.cmt: 原文には「エゴマ」とありますが、リンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語が「荏」となっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われますので、音の表記にはこちらを使用しました（意味は同じ）。
sen.e: Muko no gomagara wa e no gomagara ka magomagara ka, are koso hon no magomagara (I wonder the sesame husks over there are of perilla or ordinary sesame, they are real ordinary sesame husks).
Muko no gomagara wa e no gomagara ka magomagara ka, are koso hon no magomagara (I wonder the sesame husks over there are of perilla or ordinary sesame, they are real ordinary sesame husks).

sen.j: がらぴぃがらぴぃ風車。
sen.e: Gara-pi gara-pi kazaguruma (a pinwheel whirls with a sound).
Gara-pi gara-pi kazaguruma (a pinwheel whirls with a sound).
Gara-pi gara-pi kazaguruma (a pinwheel whirls with a sound).

sen.j: 子法師、起きゃがれ小法師、昨夜も溢してまた溢した。
sen.e: Okyagare koboshi (double meaning: get up, young monk; and a self-righting doll), okyagare koboshi, yunbe mo koboshi te mata koboshita (he spilled last night, and did it again).
sen.cmt: 原文には「子法師」とありますが、リンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語が「起きゃがれ子法師」となっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出しました。
sen.e: Okyagare koboshi (double meaning: get up, young monk; and a self-righting doll), okyagare koboshi, yunbe mo koboshi te mata koboshita (he spilled last night, and did it again).
Okyagare koboshi (double meaning: get up, young monk; and a self-righting doll), okyagare koboshi, yunbe mo koboshi te mata koboshita (he spilled last night, and did it again).

sen.j: たぁぷぽぽ、たぁぷぽぽ、ちりからちりから、つったっぽ、たっぽたっぽ一丁タコ。
sen.e: Ta-a-pu-po-po, ta-a-pu-po-po, chiri kara chiri kara, tsuttappo, tappo tappo iccho dako (octopus).
sen.cmt: 原文には「タコ」とありますが、リンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語が「蛸」となっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われます（音・意味は同じ）。
sen.e: Ta-a-pu-po-po, ta-a-pu-po-po, chiri kara chiri kara, tsuttappo, tappo tappo iccho dako (octopus).
Ta-a-pu-po-po, ta-a-pu-po-po, chiri kara chiri kara, tsuttappo, tappo tappo iccho dako (octopus).

sen.j: 落ちたら煮て食お、煮ても焼いても食われぬ物は、五徳・鉄灸、金熊童子に、石熊童子･イシモチ･虎熊童子･キス (魚)。
sen.e: Ochitara nite kuo (if it's dropped, boil it to eat), nitemo yaitemo kuwarenu monowa (things inedible even if they are boiled or grilled are), gotoku (trivet) tekkyu (grill), Kanakumadoji (a character in Demon Legend of Mt.Oe) ni (and), Ishikuma (a character in Demon Legend of Mt.Oe) ishimochi (drum) Torakuma (a character in Demon Legend of Mt.Oe) toragisu (rosy sandperch).
sen.cmt: 原文には「石熊童子」「イシモチ」 「虎熊童子」「キス（魚）」とありますが、リンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語が「石熊」「石持」「虎熊」「虎鱚」となっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出しました。
sen.e: Ochitara nite kuo (if it's dropped, boil and eat it), nitemo yaitemo kuwarenu monowa (things inedible even if they are boiled or grilled are), gotoku (trivet) tekkyu (grill), Kanakumadoji (a character in Demon Legend of Mt.Oe) ni (and), Ishikuma (a character in Demon Legend of Mt.Oe) ishimochi (drum) Torakuma (a character in Demon Legend of Mt.Oe) toragisu (rosy sandperch).
sen.cmt: 分かるように表現を少々変えました。
sen.e: Ochitara nite kuo (if it's dropped, boil and eat it), nitemo yaitemo kuwarenu monowa (things inedible even if they are boiled or grilled are), gotoku (trivet) tekkyu (grill), Kanakumadoji (a character in Demon Legend of Mt.Oe) ni (and), Ishikuma (a character in Demon Legend of Mt.Oe) ishimochi (drum) Torakuma (a character in Demon Legend of Mt.Oe) toragisu (rosy sandperch).

sen.j: 中でも東寺の羅城門には、茨木童子が腕栗五合掴んでおむしゃる、彼の源頼光の膝元去らず。
sen.e: Nakademo Toji no Rashomon niwa, Ibaragidoji ga udekuri gongo tsukande omusharu, kano Raiko no hizamoto sarazu (among all, at Rajomon Gate of Toji Temple, Ibaraki Doji [a character in Demon Legend of Mt.Oe] is holding 902 ml of boiled chestnuts; never leaving Raiko's [a character in Demon Legend of Mt.Oe] side).
sen.cmt: 原文には「源頼光」とありますが、リンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語が「頼光」となっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出しました。誰が「頼光の膝元去らず」なのか定かでないため、訳文のようにしました。
sen.e: Nakademo Toji no Rashomon niwa, Ibaragidoji ga udekuri gongo tsukande omusharu, kano Raiko no hizamoto sarazu (among all, at Rajomon Gate of Toji Temple, Ibaraki Doji [a character in Demon Legend of Mt.Oe] is holding 902 ml of boiled chestnuts; never leaving Raiko's [a character in Demon Legend of Mt.Oe] side).

Nakademo Toji no Rashomon niwa, Ibaragidoji ga udekuri gongo tsukande omusharu, kano Raiko no hizamoto sarazu (among all, at Rajomon Gate of Toji Temple, Ibaraki Doji [a character in Demon Legend of Mt.Oe] is holding 902 ml of boiled chestnuts; never leaving Raiko's [a character in Demon Legend of Mt.Oe] side).

sen.j: 頼光四天王後段な、蕎麦切り・素麺、うどんか愚鈍な小新発知。
sen.e: Funa kinkan siitake sadamete (a crucian carp, kumquat, shiitake mushroom, surely [similar sounds with four characters' names in Demon Legend of Mt.Oe]) gotanna (a light meal after the dinner), sobakiri (noodles made from buckwheat) somen (Japanese vermicelli), udon (Japanese wheat noodle) ka (or) gudon na koshinbochi (stupid neophyte).
sen.cmt: 原文には「頼光四天王」とありますが、リンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語が「鮒･金柑･椎茸･定めて」となっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出しました。
sen.e: Funa kinkan siitake sadamete (a crucian carp, kumquat, shiitake mushroom, surely [similar sounds with four characters' names in Demon Legend of Mt.Oe]) gotanna (a light meal after the dinner), sobakiri (noodles made from buckwheat) somen (Japanese vermicelli), udon (Japanese wheat noodle) ka (or) gudon na koshinbochi (stupid neophyte).

Funa kinkan siitake sadamete (a crucian carp, kumquat, shiitake mushroom, surely [similar sounds with four characters' names in Demon Legend of Mt.Oe]) gotanna (a light meal after the dinner), sobakiri (noodles made from buckwheat) somen (Japanese vermicelli), udon (Japanese wheat noodle) ka (or) gudon na koshinbochi (stupid neophyte).

sen.j: 小棚の小下の小桶に小味噌が小有るぞ、小杓子小持って小掬って小寄こせ。
sen.e: Kodana no koshita no koke ni komiso ga koaru zo, koshakushi komotte kosukutte koyokose (there is a little bean paste in a little tub a little under a little shelf, hold a little of a little dipper to dip a little of it and give me a little).

Kodana no koshita no koke ni komiso ga koaru zo, koshakushi komotte kosukutte koyokose (there is a little bean paste in a little tub a little under a little shelf, hold a little of a little dipper to dip a little of it and give me a little).

Kodana no koshita no koke ni komiso ga koaru zo, koshakushi komotte kosukutte koyokose (there is a little bean paste in a little tub a little under a little shelf, hold a little of a little dipper to dip a little of it and give me a little).

sen.j: おっと合点だ、心得田圃の川崎宿･神奈川宿･程ヶ谷宿･戸塚宿は走って行けば、灸を擦り剥く。
sen.e: Otto gaten da, kokoroetanbo no Kawasaki Kanagawa Hodogaya Totsuka wa hashitte yukeba, yaito wo surimuku (oh, all right, I understand; running through Kawasaki, Kanagawa, Hodogaya and Totsuka station, you'll graze the part on which moxa is burned).
sen.cmt: 原文には「川崎宿･神奈川宿･程ヶ谷宿･戸塚宿」とありますが、リンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語が「川崎･神奈川･程ヶ谷･戸塚」となっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われますので、音の表記にはこちらを使用しました（意味は同じ）。
sen.e: Otto gatten da, kokoroetanbo no Kawasaki Kanagawa Hodogaya Totsuka wa hashitte yukeba, yaito wo surimuku (oh, all right, I understand; running through Kawasaki, Kanagawa, Hodogaya and Totsuka station, you'll graze the part on which moxa is burned).

Otto gatten da, kokoroetanbo no Kawasaki Kanagawa Hodogaya Totsuka wa hashitte yukeba, yaito wo surimuku (oh, all right, I understand; running through Kawasaki, Kanagawa, Hodogaya and Totsuka station, you'll graze the part on which moxa is burned).

sen.j: 三里ばかりか、藤沢宿･平塚宿･大磯宿がしや、小磯の宿を七つ起きして、早天早々、相州小田原、透頂香。
sen.e: Sanri bakari ka, Fujisawa Hiratsuka Oisogashiya, koiso no shuku wo nanatsuoki shite, soten soso, Soshu, Odawara, Tochinko (it's not just 11.78 km to go through the stations: Fujisawa, Hiratsuka and Oiso, how busy; I got up around four o'clock at Koiso station to bring Tochinko from Odawara City, Sagami Province).
sen.cmt: 原文には「藤沢宿･平塚宿･大磯宿」とありますが、リンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語が「藤沢･平塚･大磯」となっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われますので、音の表記にはこちらを使用しました（意味は同じ）。
sen.e: Sanri bakari ka, Fujisawa Hiratsuka Oisogashiya, koiso no shuku wo nanatsuoki shite, soten soso, Soshu, Odawara, Tochinko (it's not just 11.78 km to go through the stations: Fujisawa, Hiratsuka and Oiso, how busy; I got up around four o'clock at the Koiso station to bring Tochinko from Odawara City, Sagami Province).

Sanri bakari ka, Fujisawa Hiratsuka Oisogashiya, koiso no shuku wo nanatsuoki shite, soten soso, Soshu, Odawara, Tochinko (it's not just 11.78 km to go through the stations: Fujisawa, Hiratsuka and Oiso, how busy; I got up around four o'clock at the Koiso station to bring Tochinko from Odawara City, Sagami Province).

sen.j: 隠れ御座らぬ貴賎群衆の、花の御江戸の花ういろう。
sen.e: Kakure gozara nu kisen gunju no, hana no oedo no hana uiro (there is nothing to hide, Uiro is flourishing like the fine City of Edo where many people of both high and low birth live).
Kakure gozara nu kisen gunju no, hana no oedo no hana uiro (there is nothing to hide, Uiro is flourishing like the fine City of Edo where many people of both high and low birth live).
Kakure gozara nu kisen gunju no, hana no oedo no hana uiro (there is nothing to hide, Uiro is flourishing like the fine City of Edo where many people of both high and low birth live).

sen.j: アレあの花を見て、御心を御和らぎやと言う、産子・這子に至るまで、此の外郎の御評判、御存じ無いとは申されまいまいつぶり、角出せ棒出せぼうぼう眉に、臼杵擂鉢ばちばちぐわらぐわらぐわらと、羽目を外して今日御出での何れも様に、上げねばならぬ、売らねばならぬと、息せい引っ張り、浄土の薬の元締、薬師如来も照覧あれと、ホホ敬って外郎はいらっしゃいませぬか。
sen.e: Are ano hana wo mite, okokoro wo oyawaragi ya to iu (they say you should relieve the tension watching that flower), ubuko hauko ni itaru made, kono uiro no gohyoban, gozonji nai towa mosare maimaitsuburi (even newborn babies or crawlers will never say that they have never heard Uiro's reputation, snail), tsuno dase bo dase (stick out your horns or tentacles) bobo mayu ni (shaggy eyebrows, then), usu kine suribachi bachi bachi guwara guwara guwara to (a mill-stone, pounder and earthenware mortar are making a noise), hame wo hazushi te konnichi oide no izure mo sama ni, agene ba nara nu, urane ba nara nu to, iki seihippari (being eager to sell this medicine to you all here today, on a spree), tohosekai no kusuri no motojime, Yakushinyorai mo shoran are to, ho-ho uyamatte, uiro wa irassharimasenu ka (asking Yakushi Nyorai [the Healing Buddha], the manager of medicine in Pure Land, to see this; with respect, would you like Uiro)?
sen.cmt: 原文には「浄土」とありますが、リンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語が「東方世界」となっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われますので、音の表記にはこちらを使用しました（意味は同じ）。
sen.e: Are ano hana wo mite, okokoro wo oyawaragi ya to iu (they say you should relieve the tension watching that flower), ubuko hauko ni itaru made, kono uiro no gohyoban, gozonji nai towa mosare maimaitsuburi (even newborn babies or crawlers will never say that they have never heard Uiro's reputation, snail), tsuno dase bo dase (stick out your horns or tentacles) bobo mayu ni (shaggy eyebrows, then), usu kine suribachi bachi bachi guwara guwara guwara to (a mill-stone, pounder and earthenware mortar are making a noise), hame wo hazushi te konnichi oide no izure mo sama ni, agene ba nara nu, urane ba nara nu to, iki seihippari (being eager to sell this medicine to you all here today, on a spree), tohosekai no kusuri no motojime, Yakushinyorai mo shoran are to, ho-ho uyamatte, uiro wa irassharimasenu ka (asking Yakushi Nyorai [the Healing Buddha], the manager of medicine in the Pure Land, to see this; with respect, would you like Uiro)?

Are ano hana wo mite, okokoro wo oyawaragi ya to iu (they say you should relieve the tension watching that flower), ubuko hauko ni itaru made, kono uiro no gohyoban, gozonji nai towa mosare maimaitsuburi (even newborn babies or crawlers will never say that they have never heard Uiro's reputation, snail), tsuno dase bo dase (stick out your horns or tentacles) bobo mayu ni (shaggy eyebrows, then), usu kine suribachi bachi bachi guwara guwara guwara to (a mill-stone, pounder and earthenware mortar are making a noise), hame wo hazushi te konnichi oide no izure mo sama ni, agene ba nara nu, urane ba nara nu to, iki seihippari (being eager to sell this medicine to you all here today, on a spree), tohosekai no kusuri no motojime, Yakushinyorai mo shoran are to, ho-ho uyamatte, uiro wa irassharimasenu ka (asking Yakushi Nyorai [the Healing Buddha], the manager of medicine in the Pure Land, to see this; with respect, would you like Uiro)?
